answers.answer: Inpatient medical recovery services, including physical medicine and rehabilitation, are provided in sanatoriums, which can have a spa profile, for both children and adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medical recovery services in hospitals are provided in sanatorium wards or spa sanatorium units, offering inpatient services for both children and adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Spa sanatorium recovery can be granted for a maximum duration of 14-21 days per year, divisible into up to two fractions upon physician recommendation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Spa sanatorium recovery includes a minimum of 4 procedures per day for at least 5 days per week.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Medical recovery services are also provided for periods shorter than 14 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Patients are required to pay a personal contribution for services received at spa sanatoriums or spa sanatorium units in hospitals.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries of Emergency Ordinance no. 15/2022, concerning humanitarian support for persons from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine, are exempt from paying the personal contribution for medical recovery services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Medical services provided beyond the initial 21-day hospitalization period must be fully covered by the patients themselves.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Referral notes for spa treatment are issued by family medicine doctors or specialists in ambulatory and hospital settings who have contractual relations with health insurance companies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Eligibility for spa sanatorium treatment is determined by the specific pathology and associated conditions of the patient.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: The flow of medical recovery services is determined by physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists for spa sanatoriums, and by specialist doctors working in non-spa units for those services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medical recovery services offered in sanatoriums other than spas and preventive sanatoriums are provided in hospitalization.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery services provided in sanatoriums other than spas and preventive sanatoriums'.

answers.answer: Recovery in non-spa sanatoriums is not limited to a certain number of days, with periods established by the specialist doctors working in those units.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read the section under 'Medical recovery services provided in sanatoriums other than spas and preventive sanatoriums'.
